head.p: from: Jane to: David subject: Your plans to move to Berlin date:30/11/2021

p.s: I heard you won your tournament last weekend, how was it?
Anyway, I found this article called Berlin spricht Englisch which was posted on the Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung on the 15th of July 2016 and was written by Marina Kormbaki.
The title means Berlin speaks English and I thought that this could help you with your decision to move to Berlin.
So first of all Kormbaki compares Berlin with London, Brooklyn and Sydney.
This city is in a change as of takylo.
A lot of tourists and students are coming to Berlin and although a lot of them leave eventually they helped in developing a surrounding that is attractive for English speaking people.
For example the fact, that you have the advantage when you want to go out eat something in Neukölln or subillerkiez because a lot of the restaurants promote their dishes in englishEnglish.
Or that there are a lot of shops and cafés that are undistinguishable from ones in Toronto, Hongkong or Los Angeles.
David Walker, an englishEnglish programmer says that Berlin is different from the other parts of germanyGermany and that people at his work talk englishEnglish all the time.
There are bookstores dedicated to englishEnglish books only and countless other shops that have daily englishEnglish cutsomers.
So you would have a good and easy time in Berlin, especially with the relatively low prizes for apartments but also every other imaginable things like café.
I hope I could help you out.
